docs.lead_paragraph: New mothers are staying in the hospital a little longer -- about half a day more on average, according to the first study conducted since a public outcry over ''drive-by deliveries.'' The trend began even before a Federal law requiring insurance coverage of 48-hour stays went into effect. In the early 1990's, many insurance companies began paying only for 24-hour hospital stays for vaginal deliveries.

headline.main: Moms Gaining Time in Maternity Wards

docs.abstract: Study shows that new mothers are staying in hospital a little longer--about half day more on average--in first study conducted since public outcry over 'driveby deliveries'; trend began even before Federal law requiring insurance coverage of 48-hour stays went into effect (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: Last Thursday, 43 seconds into the New York Liberty's opening game, Rebecca Lobo jumped for a rebound, pivoted and fell to the floor clutching her knee and screaming in pain. An off-balance landing resulted in a torn anterior cruciate ligament, an injury that will require surgery and months of rehabilitation. For the Women's National Basketball Association star it means sitting out the season. The same day researchers and physicians from around the country gathered in Hunt Valley, Md., for a symposium on A.C.L. injuries and the female athlete, sponsored by the American Academy of Orthopedic Surgeons, and earlier this month, the American College of Sports Medicine presented a half-day workshop on the topic at its annual conference. The Journal of Athletic Training has devoted its current issue to exploring the potential risk of such injuries and possible preventive measures.

headline.main: An Achilles Heel, in the Knee

docs.abstract: Growing attention is being given to anterior cruciate ligament of the knee and female athlete's susceptibility to knee injuries; photo; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: If, as social scientists sometimes insist, the best predictor of future behavior is past behavior, then Dr. Steven Hyman was an unlikely candidate when the National Institute of Mental Health was searching for a director three years ago. Other psychiatrists who had filled that post were clinical psychiatrists. But Dr. Hyman, though he saw patients one morning a week, was a bench scientist at heart, at home with pipette and petri dish, deeply immersed in the molecular underpinnings of addiction and mood disorders. And he was only 43, much younger than previous directors.

headline.main: Tireless, Outspoken and Atypical, Mental Health Chief Rocks the Boat

docs.abstract: Profile of Dr Steven Hyman, director of National Institute of Mental Health; Hyman, a scientist immersed in molecular underpinnings of addiction and mood disorders, was chosen as institute director three years ago to take advantage of new tools in psychiatry; is credited with exerting strong leadership at a time when mental health is attracting unprecedented public attention; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: As warm and wonderful as it feels to bask under the rays of the summer sun, it is not very good for the body. In my teen-age years, we had tanning contests to see who could get the darkest the fastest. In my 20's, I slathered my bikini-clad body in baby oil to attract as many tanning rays as I could in the little time I had for sunbathing. Now, decades later, when I look at the spotted skin that has begun to wrinkle on my arms and legs, I cannot help wishing I had known then what I know now. Although most Americans still precede the word ''tan'' with ''healthy,'' it is anything but. A tan, which results from the formation of the pigment melanin in skin cells called melanocytes, is the body's attempt to defend itself against sun damage.

headline.main: In a Culture of Sunbathers, Tips for Shielding the Skin

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column on protecting oneself from hazards of sunburn; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The act of slathering on expensive thigh-reducing creams, may provide an upper body workout, but users should not expect to see weight loss in their thighs, a new study reports. The research, presented recently at the annual American College of Sports Medicine conference in Seattle, showed no significant reduction in thigh circumference when overweight and normal-weight women applied the creams for six weeks. Unlike previous research in which the subjects, who were obese, also dieted and exercised, the 11 women in this small study were asked not to change their exercise or eating routines.
docs.abstract: New study finds that users of expensive thigh-reducing creams containing aminophylline should not expect to see weight loss in their thighs (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: I was the oldest one in the exercise class by nearly 30 years, and I'm only 36. As a yoga novice, Jack, my 5-year-old, was allowed to bring his mother along. Yoga for kids, I soon learned, is a burgeoning industry -- a recent outgrowth of the latest adult trend. There are courses for children and mommy-and-me yoga classes. There are books galore and video tapes. We now own the video, ''E-i-E-i Yoga.'' It is of the Barney ilk with farmer Yogi Oki Doki replacing the purple dinosaur.

headline.main: Hardly Out of Diapers and Now Into Yoga

docs.abstract: Randi Hutter Epstein describes taking yoga exercise class with her five-year-old son; notes yoga, no longer just for stretching an adult's muscles or relieving stress of hard day's work, has rewards for children as well; drawings (The Novice column) (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Refining the understanding of a crucial step in early pregnancy, researchers have pinpointed the time frame in which a fertilized egg needs to implant itself into the uterus. In a study of 221 healthy women who were trying to conceive, researchers from the National Institutes of Health found that in most successful cases, implantation occurred 8 to 10 days after the women ovulated. Of perhaps more interest, they found that the later the egg implanted itself, the greater the chance the pregnancy would fail.

headline.main: A Common Link in Failed Pregnancies

docs.abstract: Researchers at National Institutes of Health pinpoint time frame in which fertilized egg needs to implant itself into uterus; in most successful cases, implantation occurs 8 to 10 days after women ovulated; the later the egg implants itself, the greater the chance the pregnancy will fail (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A new study has found that teaching healthy elderly people to play music decreases their anxiety, depression and loneliness. The study, undertaken jointly by the universities of Miami, South Florida, Kansas, Western Michigan, Michigan State and the Karolinska Medical Institute in Sweden, examined 130 retired people in an effort to link learning music with wellness. Sixty-one of the retirees learned to play the organ over a period of two 10-week semesters while 69 other participants did not.

headline.main: A Fountain of Youth, in Music Class

docs.abstract: New study finds that teaching healthy elderly people to play music decreases their anxiety, depression and loneliness (S)
